alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 9:56PM EDT until April 07 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale...to Shoals. White River at Edwardsport...to Hazleton. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Edwardsport to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River...at Petersburg...with brief moderate flooding possible at Hazleton Saturday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River by Sunday. The East Fork White River has crested and is forecast to continue falling...while the crest on the White River will slowly advance from Petersburg to Hazleton tonight. Minor flooding is expected to end on most of the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River...on Sunday at Edwardsport...while continuing at downriver points through next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.6 feet, INDOT may close SR 358 between SR 67 at Edwardsport to SR 57 at Plainville due to flooding. SR 358 floods on the east side of the river between the levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Friday /6:00 PM CDT Friday/ the stage was 18.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Friday /6:00 PM CDT Friday/ was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early Sunday morning to 13.2 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage Tuesday evening to 16.0 feet Wednesday evening. It will fall below flood stage again Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Saturday.
